intro: Mecranium racemosum, commonly known as the racemose mecranium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that bloom in racemose inflorescences. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a heart-shaped or ovate form. The botanical interest of Mecranium racemosum lies in its unique floral structure and its potential ecological role in its native habitats.
